amendatorysection.catchline: Repealed. Laws 2014, LB749, § 298. Operative date January 1, 2017. Service on corporation.
amendatorysection.para: (1) A corporation's registered agent shall be the corporation's agent for service of process, notice, or demand required or permitted by law to be served on the corporation.

(2) If a corporation has no registered agent, or the agent cannot with reasonable diligence be served, the corporation may be served by registered or certified mail, return receipt requested, addressed to the secretary of the corporation at its principal office. Service shall be perfected under this subsection at the earliest of:
(a) The date the corporation receives the mail;
(b) The date shown on the return receipt, if signed on behalf of the corporation; or
(c) Five days after its deposit in the United States mail as evidenced by the postmark, if mailed postage prepaid and correctly addressed.
(3) This section shall not be construed to prescribe the only means, or necessarily the required means, of serving a corporation.
